article.headline: Oregon 92, USC 74
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- A 10-day break seemed to agree with Oregon's Ian Crosswhite and James Davis, who turned in their best performances of the season in the Ducks' Pacific-10 Conference opener. Crosswhite scored 22 points and Davis had 21, tying career highs, to lead the Ducks to a 92-74 victory Friday night over USC. Crosswhite also grabbed a career-best 13 rebounds and Davis made seven of 10 shots from 3-point range, tying a career high and falling one short of the school's single-game record. Oregon, which earned its ninth victory in 10 conference openers by beating the Trojans, had not played since Dec. 22. Davis called the rest "definitely refreshing." "We had that chance to go home for Christmas and spend time with family and friends," Davis said. "I think we're definitely rejuvenated to get back into Pac-10 play." Davis and Crosswhite combined on an 11-0 run that gave Oregon a 49-33 halftime lead. "I really credit my big guys," said Davis, whose shooting helped the Ducks (6-2, 1-0) make 14 of 23 shots from 3-point range. "They set excellent screens to get me open." Crosswhite attributed his success to greater familiarity with the inside game. "I'm feeling a lot more comfortable down in the post," he said. "I have to be confident, go as hard as possible and start out by doing the little things -- rebounding, defense." Luke Jackson added 14 points and Aaron Brooks scored 13 points for the Ducks. Desmon Farmer led the Trojans (5-5, 0-1) with 15 points. Jeff McMillan added 14 points and nine rebounds. Oregon forward Mitch Platt returned to action for the first time since Dec. 6, when he sprained his left ankle against Marshall. Platt started the season's first three games.
